JUnit doesnt guarantee the order of the tests. Your tests shouldnt rely on
other tests being executed before them.

joe

> -----Original Message-----
> From: scott.marshall@...
> [mailto:scott.marshall@...]
> Sent: 14 February 2002 08:26
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Test Order Execution
> 
> 
> I'm currently developing JUnitEE for use with a J2EE 
> application, and admit to being relatively new to J2EE and 
> JUnit. However, I am getting problems running test suites as 
> the order of execution does not appear to be constant. 
> Tests are written in this order : 
> testGetVehicle() 
> testAddVehicle() 
> testSaveVehicle() 
> testDeleteVehicle() 
> 
> Overall flow is to retrieve an entity, modify it, then delete it. 
> 
> Tests appear to be executed in this order : 
> testDeleteVehicle() 
> testGetVehicle() 
> testAddVehicle() 
> testSaveVehicle() 
> 
> By running out of order the testDeleteVehicle() method cant 
> find the modified entity, and fails its test. 
> 
> Using JBuilder 6, is this related to most recent changes and 
> compilation ? JUnitEE itself appears to be working fine. Any 
> pointers of where to look ? 
> 
> Thanks 
> 
> Scott 
> 
>
